sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Display Managers are graphical programs used for starting the graphical display (currently, the X server) et loging in a Windows Manager or Desktop Environment.
There are many Display Managers available. Some of the more well known include GDM, KDM, LightDM, LXDM, Slim, et SDDM.
Between the Desktop Environments available for Linux you find Enlightenment, GNOME, KDE, LXDE, LXQt, et XFce.
Choosing a Display Manager or Display Environment is highly subjective. The choice depends on the look et feel of the packages, the resources (RAM, disk space) required, et the utilities included.
In this chapter, the installation instructions of some Display Managers are presented. Later in the book, you will find other ones, which are provided as part of some Desktop Envireonments.
